name: aloes-status-icon
format:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<svg viewBox="0 0 270 40" id="{{'aloes-status-'+ $id}}">
    <text x="0" y="25">{{'aloes status : ' + $statusText}}</text>
    <circle id="{{'aloes-status-icon-'+$id}}" x="0" y="0" cx="250" cy="20" r="15" fill="{{$statusColor}}" ></circle>
</svg>
<script>
(function(scope) {
  scope.$watch('msg', (msg) => {
    try{
        scope.$statusText = "offline";
        scope.$statusColor = "#ff4500";
        if (msg && (msg.payload === true || msg.payload === "true")) {
            scope.$statusColor = "#baff00";
            scope.$statusText = "online";
        }
        return msg;
    } catch(error){
        throw error;
    }
  });
})(scope);
</script>

name: device-status-icon
format:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<svg viewBox="0 0 270 40" id="{{'status-'+ $id}}">
    <text x="0" y="25">{{'device status : ' + $statusText}}</text>
    <circle id="{{'status-icon-'+$id}}" x="0" y="0" cx="250" cy="20" r="15" fill="{{$statusColor}}" ></circle>
</svg>
<script>
(function(scope) {
  scope.$watch('msg', (msg) => {
    try{
        scope.$statusText = "Waiting";
        scope.$statusColor = "#ff4500";
        if (msg && (msg.payload === true || msg.payload === "true")) {
            scope.$statusColor = "#baff00";
            scope.$statusText = "Ready";
        }
        return msg;
    } catch(error){
        throw error;
    }
  });
})(scope);
</script>

name: setRequest
set-aloes-env
set-aloes-request
parse-HTTP-response
get-ressources
info:
**get-resources**

Get all devices registered on Aloes.
( For the account logged in this node-red session )

`ALOES_HTTP_HOST` Aloes instance host ( eg localhost, example.com )

`ALOES_HTTP_PORT` Aloes instance host ( eg 80, 443, .. )

`ALOES_USER_ID`  set automatically at node-red start

`ALOES_TOKEN` set automatically at node-red start

`NODE_RED_STORE_TYPE`

name: parse-sensor-resources
aloes-client-tx
info:
**aloes-client**

Connect to MQTT via aloes account.

Publish msg.payload to msg.topic.

( For the account logged in this node-red session )

`ALOES_MQTT_HOST` Aloes instance host ( eg localhost, example.com )

`ALOES_MQTT_PORT` Aloes instance host ( eg 1883, 3000, . )

`ALOES_USER_ID`  set automatically at node-red start

`ALOES_TOKEN` set automatically at node-red start

`ALOES_CLIENT_ID` ( default empty )

name: set-aloes-packet
aloes-client-rx
info:
**aloes-client**

Connect to MQTT via aloes account.

Subscribe to main topic and parse msg.payload into :
    - msg.device 
    - msg.sensor
    - msg.auth

( For the account logged in this node-red session )

`ALOES_MQTT_HOST` Aloes instance host ( eg localhost, example.com )

`ALOES_MQTT_PORT` Aloes instance host ( eg 1883, 3000, . )

`ALOES_USER_ID`  set automatically at node-red start

`ALOES_TOKEN` set automatically at node-red start

`ALOES_TOPIC_IN` topic to listen ( default USER_ID/# )

`ALOES_CLIENT_ID` ( default empty )

name: update-client-status
MQTT OUT
info:
Wait for valid device/sensor instance to send via MQTT

Use update-instance node before, to validate your instance.

name: clock-toolbar
format:
<script id="titleScript" type="text/javascript">

$(function() {
    if($('.md-toolbar-tools').length != 0){
        loadClock();
    } else setTimeout(loadClock, 500)
});

function loadClock(){
    $('#clock').remove();
    var toolbar = $('.md-toolbar-tools');
    
    var div = $('<div/>');
    var p = $('<p/ id="clock">');
    
    div.append(p);
    div[0].style.margin = '5px 5px 5px auto';
    toolbar.append(div);

    function displayTitle(lh) {
        p.text(lh); 
    }
    
    function upTime() {
        var d = new Date();
        p.text(d.toLocaleString());
    }
    if(document.clockInterval){ 
        clearInterval(document.clockInterval);
        document.clockInterval = null;
    }
    document.clockInterval = setInterval(upTime,1000);
}

</script>
